page.title: 01Great Barford and Roxton
page.content: Great Barford and Roxton are two North Bedfordshire villages linked by the A428 main road.The surrounding countryside is mainly farmland used for arable crops. Great Barford has grown considerably in size over the last twenty years and now most people live in modern housing and travel to work in Bedford,St.Neots Cambridge or London.It is still an attractive village though,with three {Conservation Areas.} Roxton is a compact village between the A1 and A428 roads.It has an interesting High Street,the whole of which has been included in a Conservation Area.Both villages have a numder of thatched cottages. Both villages were mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086.
